question.text: Select the incorrect statement about multiple ovulation embryo transfer (MOET) technology.

options.text: <math><mtext>MOET</mtext></math> is one of the programme for herd improvement and applied for cattle (including cows), buffaloes, sheep, goat, rabbit, mares etc.
In this, a cow is administered hormones, with  <math><mtext>FSH</mtext></math>  like activity to induce follicular maturation and super ovulation.
The fertilised eggs at <math><mtext>8-32</mtext></math> cells stages are recovered surgically and transferred to surrogate mother.
This method is used to increase the herd size in a short time period.

solution.text: In multiple ovulation embryo transfer technology <math><mo>(</mo><mtext>MOET</mtext><mo>),</mo></math> instead of one egg, <math><mtext>6-8</mtext></math> eggs are produced per cycle (called multiple ovulation). After artificial or natural insemination, all these eggs are fertilised. These fertilised eggs at <math><mtext>8-32</mtext></math> cells stages are recovered non-surgically and transferred to surrogate mothers.
